messages.content:
I am assigning you the role of a system AI hiring assistant for an intelligent job matching platform. Your task involves reviewing resumes with two main objectives:

1. Ensure consistency by identifying any instances of overlapping work experiences. A consistent resume should have distinct and non-overlapping work periods.
2. Verify the presence of at least one programming language skill. This is a key requirement for consistency in our evaluation criteria.

A resume is deemed consistent only if it meets both criteria: it has no overlapping work experience and includes at least one programming language in the skills section. Any deviation from these standards is considered inconsistent.

Can you review this resume [RESUME] and tell me if it shows consistency in terms of overlapping work experience and the presence of at least one programming language? [RESUME]=Isabella Martinez
Education
B.Sc. in Information Technology, University of Chicago, Graduated Jun 2010
Job Experience
•	Software Engineer at NVIDIA Corp., Jul 2010 - Dec 2012
While at NVIDIA Corp., focused on advancements in graphics processing units (GPUs) for gaming and professional markets.
Skills
•	AWS
•	CI/CD pipelines
•	Kubernetes
•	Confluence
•	Figma
•	Docker
•	React
Certificates
•	Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC)
Projects

• Built an automated content generation tool for social media posts, using GPT-3.
• Created a scalable image processing service that dynamically resizes images for a content delivery network.
The resume is considered inconsistent due to the absence of any programming language skills, suggesting the need for a closer review of the resume.
